update.description:
As we discussed - refactored thrust plugin to be more flexible.  Current setup has two defined thrusters with separate topics to provide commands to each thruster.  This should make it much easier to extend to other thruster configurations:

1. adding thruster articulation for vectored thrust
2. adding a lateral/bow thruster
3. changing to the four thruster “holonomic” configuration

This also gets rid of our custom UsvDrive message!

Once PR is good to go, then I’ll make some small changes to the tutorial and put together and example or two of other thruster configurations.

Commits:

* first steps towards new structure
* increment, pushing to work from home
* increment - builds, but need to go home
* prior to splitting thruster into its own header
* working prototype - next remove old method
* props now spinning, removed old method of thrust implementation, removed custome UsvDrive message
* refactor driving examples for new thrust structure
* changing some of the file names to be a bit more explanatory
update.title: Generalize thruster desc

content.raw: Could you add a new entry to the changelog?
content.html: Could you add a new entry to the changelog?

content.raw: Thank you - I think I addressed the comments with [65be7e2](#!/osrf/vmrc/commits/65be7e2dc73f3058e8213f35787003d09f1a3485)
content.html: Thank you - I think I addressed the comments with 65be7e2

content.raw: No - some issue with the particular gamepad I was using, but I believe 3 is the correct axis for our recommended gamepad.
content.html: No - some issue with the particular gamepad I was using, but I believe 3 is the correct axis for our recommended gamepad.

content.raw: **Reminder**: Update the [Driving](#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/Driving)  tutorial after merging, as the name of the launch file has changed for keypad teleop.
content.html: Reminder: Update the Driving tutorial after merging, as the name of the launch file has changed for keypad teleop.

content.raw: I made a few minor changes in [a3830d9](#!/osrf/vmrc/commits/a3830d9ccd2693def38c99edde47bbc28bf3733f?at=default). The most relevant is the use of a mutex to protect `lastCmdTime` and `currCmd` for each thruster, as there was risk of a race condition between the callback `OnThrustCmd()` and `Update()`. I left two minor suggestions/questions but ready to approve soon.
content.html: I made a few minor changes in a3830d9. The most relevant is the use of a mutex to protect lastCmdTime and currCmd for each thruster, as there was risk of a race condition between the callback OnThrustCmd() and Update(). I left two minor suggestions/questions but ready to approve soon.
